setup.desc: To start using SFTPGo you need to create an administrator user
setup.install_code_mismatch: The installation code does not match

login.forgot_password_msg: Enter your account username below, you will receive a password reset code by email.
login.two_factor_help: Open the two-factor authentication app on your device to view your authentication code and verify your identity.
login.recovery_code_msg: You can enter one of your recovery codes in case you lost access to your mobile device.
login.reset_pwd_msg: Check your email for the confirmation code
login.reset_pwd_forbidden: You are not allowed to reset your password
login.reset_pwd_no_email: Your account does not have an email address, it is not possible to reset your password by sending an email verification code
login.reset_pwd_send_email_err: Unable to send confirmation code via email
login.reset_ok_login_error: The password reset completed successfully but an unexpected error occurred while signing in
login.ip_not_allowed: Login is not allowed from this IP address
login.two_factor_required: Set up two-factor authentication, it is required for the following protocols: {{val}}
login.two_factor_required_generic: Set up two-factor authentication, it is mandatory for your account

general.invalid_auth_request: The authentication request does not meet security requirements
general.error400: The received request is not valid
general.error403: You do not have the required permissions
general.error404: The requested resource does not exist
general.error416: The requested file fragment could not be returned
general.error500: The server is unable to fulfill your request
general.errorPDF: This file does not look like a PDF
general.error_edit_size: The file size exceeds the maximum allowed size
general.invalid_csrf: The form token is not valid
general.confirm_logout: Are you sure you want to sign out?
general.delete_confirm: Do you want to delete "{{- name}}"? This action is irreversible
general.delete_confirm_generic: Do you want to delete the selected item? This action is irreversible
general.delete_multi_confirm: Do you want to delete the selected items? This action is irreversible
general.delete_error_generic: Unable to delete the selected item
general.name: Name
general.name_different: The new name must be different from the current name
general.html5_media_not_supported: Your browser does not support HTML5 audio/video.
general.api_key_auth_help: Allow to impersonate yourself, in REST API, using an API key
general.pub_keys_help: Public keys can be used for SFTP authentication
general.ip_mask_help: Comma separated IP/Mask in CIDR format, for example "192.168.1.0/24,10.8.0.100/32"
general.err_protocol_forbidden: HTTP protocol is not allowed for your user
general.pwd_login_forbidden: The password login method is not allowed for your user
general.ip_forbidden: Login not allowed from this IP address
general.err_password_complexity: The password provided does not meet the complexity requirements
general.no_oidc_feature: This feature is not available if you are logged in with OpenID
general.connection_forbidden: You are not allowed to connect
general.no_permissions: You are not allowed to change anything
general.err_quota_read: Read denied due to quota limit
general.profile_updated: Your profile has been successfully updated
general.share_ok: Share access successful, you can now use your link
general.quota_scan_started: Quota scan started. It can take a while depending on the number of files to check
general.quota_scan_conflit: Another scan is already in progress
general.skip_tls_verify: Skip TLS verify. This should be used only for testing
general.name_invalid: The specified name is not valid, the following characters are allowed: a-zA-Z0-9-_.~
general.expired_session: Your session has expired. Please log in again

fs.upload_queue_not_ready: The upload queue is still loading, please try again in a few moments
fs.invalid_name: File or folder names cannot contain "/"
fs.err_generic: Unable to access the requested resource

delete_multi.err_generic_partial: Not all the selected items have been deleted, please reload the page
delete_multi.err_generic: Unable to delete the selected items

move.err_unsupported: Unsupported: if you want to move a directory make sure it is empty

rename.title: Rename "{{- name}}"
rename.err_unsupported: Unsupported: if you want to rename a directory make sure it is empty

upload.message: Drop files here or click to upload.
upload.err_dir_overwrite: $t(fs.upload.err_generic). There are directories with the same name as the files: {{- val}}
upload.overwrite_text: Conflict detected. Do you want to overwrite the following files/directories?

2fa.title: Two-factor authentication using Authenticator apps
2fa.msg_info: Two-factor authentication adds an extra layer of security to your account. To log in you'll need to provide an additional authentication code.
2fa.require: Two-factor authentication is required for this account
2fa.recovery_codes_msg1: Recovery codes are one-time-use backup codes for logging in when you can't access your authentication app. Use them to access your account and manage two-factor authentication settings if you lose your phone.
2fa.recovery_codes_msg2: To keep your account secure, don't share or distribute your recovery codes. We recommend saving them with a secure password manager.
2fa.recovery_codes_msg3: If you generate new recovery codes, you automatically invalidate old ones.
2fa.info1: SSH protocol (SFTP/SCP/SSH commands) will ask for the passcode if the client uses keyboard interactive authentication.
2fa.info2: HTTP protocol means Web UI and REST APIs. Web UI will ask for the passcode using a specific page. For REST API you have to add the passcode using an HTTP header.
2fa.info3: FTP has no standard way to support two-factor authentication, if you enable the FTP support, you have to add the TOTP passcode after the password. For example if your password is "password" and your one time passcode is "123456" you have to use "password123456" as password.
2fa.info4: WebDAV is not supported since each single request must be authenticated and a passcode cannot be reused.
2fa.setup_msg: Use your preferred Authenticator App (e.g. Microsoft Authenticator, Google Authenticator, Authy, 1Password etc. ) to scan the QR code. It will generate an authentication code for you to enter below.
2fa.setup_help: If you have trouble using the QR code, select manual entry on your app, and enter the code:
2fa.disable_confirm: Do you want to disable two-factor authentication for the selected user? This action is generally only required if the user has lost access to the second authentication factor
2fa.disable_question: Do you want to disable two-factor authentication?
2fa.generate_question: Do you want to generate a new secret key and invalidate the previous one? Any registered Authenticator App will stop working
2fa.recovery_codes_gen_err: Failed to generate new recovery codes
2fa.auth_code_invalid: Failed to validate the provided authentication code
2fa.save_err: Failed to save two-factor authentication configuration
2fa.no_protocol: Please select at least a protocol
2fa.required_protocols: The security policy configured for your account requires two-factor authentication for the following protocols: {{val}}

share.scope_help: For scope "Write" and "Read/Write" you have to define a single path and it must be a directory
share.path_help: file or directory path, i.e. /dir or /dir/file.txt
share.password_help: If set the share will be password-protected
share.max_tokens_help: Maximum number of times this share can be accessed. 0 means no limit
share.err_no_password: You are not allowed to share files/folders without password
share.expiration_out_of_range: Set an expiration date and make sure it is less than or equal to {{- val, datetime}}
share.path_required: At least a path is required
share.path_write_scope: The write scope requires exactly one path
share.expiration_past: The expiration date must be in the future
share.browsable_multiple_paths: A share with multiple paths is not browsable
share.browsable_non_dir: The share is not a directory so it is not browsable
share.link_single_desc: You can download the shared content as a single zip file
share.link_dir_desc: If the share consists of a single directory, you can browse and download files
share.link_uncompressed_desc: If the share consists of a single file, it can also be downloaded uncompressed
share.upload_desc: You can upload one or more files to the shared directory
share.expired_desc: This share is no longer accessible because it has expired
share.invalid_path: The shared directory is missing or not accessible

change_pwd.info: Enter your current password, for security reasons, and then your new password twice, to verify that you have written it correctly. You will be logged out after changing your password
change_pwd.required_fields: Please provide the current password and the new one two times
change_pwd.no_match: The two password fields do not match
change_pwd.no_different: The new password must be different from the current one
change_pwd.required: Password change is required. Set a new password to continue using your account

user.username_invalid: The specified username is not valid, the following characters are allowed: a-zA-Z0-9-_.~
user.home_invalid: The home directory must be an absolute path
user.key_invalid_size: Invalid RSA public key: the minimum supported size is 2048
user.key_insecure: Insecure public key format not allowed
user.err_primary_group: Only one primary group is allowed
user.err_permissions_generic: Invalid permissions: Make sure you use valid absolute paths
user.folder_path_required: The virtual folder mount path is required
user.folder_quota_size_invalid: The quota as size of virtual folders must be greater than or equal to -1
user.folder_quota_file_invalid: The quota as files of virtual folders must be greater than or equal to -1
user.folder_quota_invalid: Quotas as size and as number of files of virtual folders must be both -1 or greater or equal than 0
user.ip_filters_invalid: Invalid IP filters, make sure they respect CIDR notation, for example 192.168.1.0/24
user.share_expiration_invalid: The expiration for shares must be greater than or equal to the defined default value
user.file_pattern_path_invalid: File name pattern filter paths must be absolute
user.file_pattern_duplicated: Duplicated file name pattern filters detected
user.disable_active_2fa: Two-factor authentication cannot be disabled for a user with an active configuration
user.pwd_change_conflict: It is not possible to request a password change and at the same time prevent the password from being changed
user.two_factor_conflict: You can't require two-factor authentication and at the same time prevent it from being set up
user.role_help: Users with a role can be managed by global administrators and administrators with the same role
user.require_pwd_change_help: The user will need to change the password from WebClient to activate the account
user.groups_help: Groups membership impart the groups settings with the exception of membership only groups
user.template_help: For each user set the username and at least one of the password and public key
user.virtual_folders_help: Quota size/files -1 means included within user quota, 0 unlimited. Don't set -1 for shared folders. You can use MB/GB/TB suffix. Without suffix we assume bytes
user.disconnect: Disconnect the user after the update
user.disconnect_help: This way you force the user to login again, if connected, and so to use the new configuration
user.expires_in_help: Account expiration as number of days from the creation. 0 means no expiration
user.tls_certs_help: TLS certificates can be used for FTP and/or WebDAV authentication
user.tls_cert_help: Paste a PEM encoded TLS certificate here
user.template_title: Create one or more new users from this template
user.template_help1: Placeholders will be replaced in paths and credentials of the configured storage backend.
user.template_help2: The generated users can be saved or exported. Exported users can be imported from the "Maintenance" section of this SFTPGo instance or another.
user.template_no_user: No valid user defined, unable to complete the requested action
user.time_of_day_invalid: Invalid time of day. Supported format HH:MM
user.time_of_day_conflict: Invalid time of day. The end time cannot be earlier than the start time

group.err_delete_referenced: Cannot delete a group with associated users, remove associations first
group.help: The %username% placeholder will be replaced with the username of the associated users, %role% with their role

virtual_folders.quota_size_help: 0 means no limit. You can use MB/GB/TB suffix
virtual_folders.template_title: Create one or more new virtual folders from this template
virtual_folders.template_name_placeholder: replaced with the name of the specified virtual folder
virtual_folders.template_help: The generated virtual folders can be saved or exported. Exported folders can be imported from the "Maintenance" section of this SFTPGo instance or another.
virtual_folders.name: Virtual folder name
virtual_folders.template_no_folder: No valid virtual folder defined, unable to complete the requested action

storage.title: File system
storage.label: Storage
storage.home_dir_placeholder: Absolute path to a directory on local disk
storage.home_dir_help1: Leave blank for an appropriate default
storage.home_dir_help2: Leave blank and storage to "Local disk" to not override the root directory
storage.home_dir_help3: Required for local disk storage providers. For other storage providers this folder will be used for temporary files, you can leave it blank for an appropriate default
storage.home_dir_invalid: Invalid root directory, make sure it is an absolute path
storage.sftp_home_help: Restrict access to this SFTP path. Example: "/somedir/subdir"
storage.sse_customer_key_help: You can store your data encrypted with this key, but if you lose or change this key, you will lose all files encrypted with it. Files that are not encrypted or encrypted with a different key will not be accessible
storage.endpoint_help: For AWS S3, leave blank to use the default endpoint for the specified region
storage.sftp_endpoint_help: Endpoint as host:port. The port is always required
storage.part_size_help: 0 means the default (5 MB). Minimum is 5
storage.ul_concurrency_help: How many parts are uploaded in parallel. 0 means the default (5)
storage.dl_concurrency_help: How many parts are downloaded in parallel. 0 means the default (5)
storage.ul_part_timeout_help: Max time limit, in seconds, to upload a single part. 0 means no limit
storage.gcs_ul_part_timeout_help: Max time limit, in seconds, to upload a single part. 0 means the default (32)
storage.dl_part_timeout_help: Max time limit, in seconds, to download a single part. 0 means no limit
storage.key_prefix_help: Restrict access to keys with the specified prefix. Example: "somedir/subdir/"
storage.role_arn_help: Optional IAM Role ARN to assume
storage.credentials_file_help: Add or update credentials from a JSON file
storage.auto_credentials_help: Use default application credentials or credentials from environment variables
storage.sas_url_help: Shared Access Signature URL can be used instead of account name/key
storage.passphrase_help: Passphrase used to derive the per-object encryption key
storage.passphrase_key_help: Passphrase used to protect your private key, if any
storage.fingerprints_help: SHA256 fingerprints to be validated when connecting to the external SFTP server, one per line. If empty any host key will be accepted: this is a security risk!
storage.sftp_buffer_help: A buffer size greater than 0 enables concurrent transfers
storage.relaxed_equality_check_help: Enable to consider only the endpoint to determine if different configurations point to the same server. By default, both the endpoint and username must match
storage.key_prefix_invalid: $t(storage.fs_error): invalid key prefix, cannot start with "/"

oidc.token_expired: Your OpenID token has expired, please log in again
oidc.token_invalid_webadmin: Your OpenID token is not valid for the WebAdmin UI. Log out of your OpenID server and log in to WebAdmin
oidc.token_invalid_webclient: Your OpenID token is not valid for the WebClient UI. Log out of your OpenID server and log in to the WebClient
oidc.role_admin_err: Incorrect OpenID role, logged in user is not an administrator
oidc.role_user_err: Incorrect OpenID role, logged in user is an administrator
oidc.get_user_err: Failed to get user associated with OpenID token

oauth2.token_exchange_err: Unable to get OAuth2 token from authorization code
oauth2.no_refresh_token: The OAuth2 provider returned an empty token. Some providers only return the token when the user first authorizes. If you have already registered SFTPGo with this user in the past, revoke access and try again. This way you will invalidate the previous token
oauth2.success: Copy the following string, without the quotes, into SMTP OAuth2 Token configuration field:

filters.password_strength_help: Values in the 50-70 range are suggested for common use cases. 0 means disabled, any password will be accepted
filters.password_expiration_help: Password expiration as number of days. 0 means no expiration
filters.default_shares_expiration_help: Default expiration for new shares as number of days
filters.max_shares_expiration_help: Maximum allowed expiration, as number of days, when a user creates or updates a share
filters.directory_permissions_help: Wildcards are supported in paths, for example "/incoming/*" matches any directory within "/incoming"
filters.directory_patterns_help: Comma separated denied or allowed files/directories, based on shell patterns. The match is case insensitive
filters.max_sessions_help: Maximum number of concurrent sessions. 0 means no limit
filters.denied_login_methods_help: "password" is valid for all supported protocols, "password-over-SSH" only for SSH/SFTP/SCP
filters.max_upload_size_help: Maximum upload size for a single file. 0 means no limit. You can use MB/GB/TB suffix
filters.upload_data_transfer_help: Maximum data transfer allowed for uploads. 0 means no limit
filters.download_data_transfer_help: Maximum data transfer allowed for downloads. 0 means no limit
filters.total_data_transfer_help: Maximum data transfer allowed for uploads + downloads. Replace the individual limits. 0 means no limit
filters.start_directory_help: Alternate initial directory to use instead of "/". Supported for SFTP/FTP/HTTP
filters.tls_username_help: Defines the TLS certificate field to use as username. Ignored if mutual TLS is disabled
filters.ftp_security_help: Ignored if TLS is already globally required for all FTP users
filters.is_anonymous_help: Anonymous users are supported for FTP and WebDAV protocols and have read-only access
filters.disable_fs_checks_help: Disable checks for existence and automatic creation of home directory and virtual folders
filters.api_key_auth_help: Allow to impersonate the user, in REST API, with an API key
filters.external_auth_cache_time_help: Cache time, in seconds, for users authenticated using an external auth hook. 0 means no cache
filters.access_time_help: No restrictions means access is always allowed, the time must be set in the format HH:MM

admin.role_permissions: A role admin cannot have the "*" permission
admin.password_help: If blank the current password will not be changed
admin.role_help: Setting a role limit the administrator to only manage users with the same role. Administrators with a role cannot be super administrators
admin.users_groups_help: Groups automatically selected for new users created by this admin. The admin will still be able to choose different groups. These settings are only used for this admin UI and they will be ignored in REST API/hooks
admin.user_page_pref_help: You can hide some sections from the user page. These are not security settings and are not enforced server side in any way. They are only intended to simplify the add/update user page
admin.default_users_expiration_help: Default expiration for new users as number of days
admin.require_pwd_change_help: A password change is required at the next login

connections.disconnect_confirm: Do you want to disconnect the selected connection? This action is irreversible
connections.disconnect_ko: Unable to disconnect the selected connection

role.err_delete_referenced: Cannot delete a role with associated admins, remove associations first

ip_list.ip_net_help: IP address or network in CIDR format, example: "192.168.1.1 or 10.8.0.100/32 or 2001:db8:1234::/48"
ip_list.allow_list_disabled: Allow list disabled in your configuration
ip_list.ratelimiters_disabled: Rate limiters disabled in your configuration

maintenance.backup_invalid_file: Invalid backup file, make sure it is a JSON file with valid content
maintenance.restore_error: Unable to restore your backup, check the server logs for more details
maintenance.backup_file_help: Import data from a JSON backup file
maintenance.quota_mode2: Update quota for users with quota limits

acme.title: ACME
acme.generic_error: Unable to obtain TLS certificates, check the server logs for more details
acme.help: From this section you can request free TLS certificates for your SFTPGo services using the ACME protocol and the HTTP-01 challenge type. You must create a DNS entry under a custom domain that you own which resolves to your SFTPGo public IP address and the port 80 must be publicly reachable. You can set the configuration options for the most common use cases and single node setups here, for advanced configurations refer to the SFTPGo docs. A service restart is required to apply changes
acme.domain_help: Multiple domains can be specified comma or space separated. They will be included in the same certificate
acme.email_help: Email used for registration and recovery contact
acme.port_help: If different from 80 you have to configure a reverse proxy
acme.protocols_help: Use the obtained certificates for the specified protocols

smtp.title: SMTP
smtp.err_required_fields: From address and Username cannot be both empty
smtp.help: Set the SMTP configuration replacing the one defined using env vars or config file if any
smtp.host_help: If blank the configuration is disabled
smtp.domain_help: HELO domain. Leave blank to use the server hostname
smtp.test_recipient: Address to send test emails to
smtp.oauth2_provider_help: URI to redirect to after user authentication
smtp.oauth2_tenant_help: Azure tenant. Typical values are "common", "organizations", "consumers" or the tenant identifier
smtp.recipient_required: Specify a recipient to send a test email
smtp.test_error: Unable to send test email, check server logs for more details
smtp.test_ok: No errors were reported while sending the test email. Please check your inbox to make sure
smtp.oauth2_flow_error: Unable to get the URI to start OAuth2 flow
smtp.oauth2_question: Do you want to start the OAuth2 flow to get a token?

sftp.help: From this section you can enable algorithms disabled by default. You don't need to set values already defined using env vars or config file. A service restart is required to apply changes

branding.title: Branding
branding.help: From this section you can customize SFTPGo to fit your brand and add a disclaimer to the login pages
branding.logo_help: PNG image, max accepted size 512x512, default logo size is 256x256
branding.invalid_disclaimer_url: The disclaimer URL must be an http or https link

actions.view_manage: View and manage rule actions for events
actions.err_delete_referenced: Cannot delete an action with associated rules, remove associations first
actions.http_url_help: i.e https://host:port/path. Placeholders are supported within the URL path
actions.http_url_invalid: The URL is invalid, http and https schemes are supported
actions.http_part_body_required: HTTP part body is required if no file path is provided
actions.http_multipart_body_error: Multipart requests require no body. The request body is build from the specified parts
actions.http_multipart_ctype_error: Content-Type is automatically set for multipart requests
actions.command_invalid: Invalid command, it must be an absolute path
actions.email_recipient_required: At least one email recipient is required
actions.retention_directory_required: At least one directory to check is required
actions.path_required: At least a path is required
actions.source_dest_different: Source and target path must be different
actions.root_not_allowed: The root path (/) is not allowed
actions.idp_template_required: A user or admin template is required
actions.threshold_help: An email notification will be generated for users whose password expires in a number of days less than or equal to this threshold
actions.disable_threshold_help: Inactivity in days, since last login or creation before disabling users
actions.delete_threshold_help: Inactivity in days, since last login or creation before deleting users
actions.inactivity_threshold_required: At least one inactivity threshold must be defined
actions.inactivity_thresholds_invalid: The deletion threshold must be greater than the deactivation threshold
actions.template_user_help: Template for SFTPGo users in JSON format. Placeholders are supported
actions.template_admin_help: Template for SFTPGo admins in JSON format. Placeholders are supported
actions.http_timeout_help: Ignored for multipart requests with files as attachments
actions.http_body_help: Placeholders are supported. Ignored for HTTP get requested. Leave empty for multipart requests
actions.multipart_body_help: HTTP Multipart requests allow to combine one or more sets of data into a single body. For each part, you can set a file path or a body as text. Placeholders are supported in file path, body, header values
actions.http_part_headers: Additional part headers one per line as "key: value"
actions.command_help: Absolute path of the command to execute
actions.command_args_help: Comma separated command arguments. Placeholders are supported
actions.command_env_vars_help: Placeholders are supported in values. Setting the value to "$" without quotes means retrieving the key from the environment excluding keys starting with SFTPGO_
actions.email_recipients_help: Comma separated recipients. Placeholders are supported
actions.email_bcc_help: Comma separated Bcc addresses. Placeholders are supported
actions.attachments_help: Comma separated paths to attach. Placeholders are supported. The total size is limited to 10 MB
actions.data_retention_help: Set the data retention, as hours, per path. Retention applies recursively. Setting 0 as retention means excluding the specified path
actions.paths_src_dst_help: Paths as seen by SFTPGo users. Placeholders are supported. The required permissions are granted automatically
actions.paths_help: Comma separated paths as seen by SFTPGo users. Placeholders are supported. The required permissions are granted automatically
actions.archive_path_help: Full path, as seen by SFTPGo users, to the zip archive to create. Placeholders are supported. If the specified file already exists, it is overwritten

placeholders_modal.name: Username, virtual folder name, admin username for provider events, domain name for TLS certificate events
placeholders_modal.event: Event name, for example "upload", "download" for filesystem events or "add", "update" for provider events
placeholders_modal.status: Status for filesystem events. 1 means no error, 2 means a generic error occurred, 3 means quota exceeded error
placeholders_modal.error_string: Error details. Replaced with an empty string if no errors occur
placeholders_modal.virtual_path: Path seen by SFTPGo users, for example "/adir/afile.txt"
placeholders_modal.escaped_virtual_path: HTTP query string encoded path, for example "%2Fadir%2Fafile.txt".
placeholders_modal.virtual_dir_path: Parent directory for "VirtualPath", for example if "VirtualPath" is "/adir/afile.txt", "VirtualDirPath" is "/adir"
placeholders_modal.fs_path: Full filesystem path, for example "/user/homedir/adir/afile.txt" or "C:/data/user/homedir/adir/afile.txt" on Windows
placeholders_modal.ext: File extension, for example ".txt" if the filename is "afile.txt"
placeholders_modal.object_name: File/directory name, for example "afile.txt" or provider object name
placeholders_modal.object_basename: Filename without extension, for example "afile" if the filename is "afile.txt"
placeholders_modal.object_type: Object type for provider events: "user", "group", "admin", etc
placeholders_modal.virtual_target_path: Virtual target path for rename and copy operations
placeholders_modal.target_name: Target object name for rename and copy operations
placeholders_modal.fs_target_path: Full filesystem target path for rename and copy operations
placeholders_modal.elapsed: Elapsed time as milliseconds for filesystem events
placeholders_modal.timestamp: Event timestamp as nanoseconds since epoch
placeholders_modal.year: Event year formatted as four digits
placeholders_modal.month: Event month formatted as two digits
placeholders_modal.day: Event day formatted as two digits
placeholders_modal.hour: Event hour formatted as two digits
placeholders_modal.minute: Event minute formatted as two digits
placeholders_modal.email: For filesystem events, this is the email associated with the user performing the action. For the provider events, this is the email associated with the affected user or admin. Blank in all other cases
placeholders_modal.object_data: Provider object data serialized as JSON with sensitive fields removed
placeholders_modal.object_data_string: Provider object data as JSON escaped string with sensitive fields removed
placeholders_modal.retention_reports: Data retention reports as zip compressed CSV files. Supported as email attachment, file path for multipart HTTP request and as single parameter for HTTP requests body
placeholders_modal.idp_field: Identity Provider custom fields containing a string
placeholders_modal.metadata: Cloud storage metadata for the downloaded file serialized as JSON
placeholders_modal.metadata_string: Cloud storage metadata for the downloaded file as JSON escaped string

rules.view_manage: View and manage rules for events
rules.run_confirm: Do you want to execute the selected rule?
rules.run_error_generic: Unable to run the selected rule
rules.action_required: At least one action is required
rules.fs_event_required: At least one filesystem event is required
rules.provider_event_required: At least one provider event is required
rules.schedule_required: At least one schedule is required
rules.sync_failure_actions: Synchronous execution is not supported for failure actions
rules.sync_unsupported: Synchronous execution is only supported for some filesystem events and Identity Provider logins
rules.sync_unsupported_fs_event: Synchronous execution is only supported for upload and pre-* filesystem events
rules.only_failure_actions: At least a non-failure action is required
rules.sync_action_required: Event "{{val}}" requires at least a synchronous action
rules.scheduler_help: Hours: 0-23. Day of week: 0-6 (Sun-Sat). Day of month: 1-31. Month: 1-12. Asterisk (*) indicates a match for all the values of the field. e.g. every day of week, every day of month and so on
rules.concurrent_run: Allow concurrent execution from multiple instances
rules.name_filters_help: Shell-like pattern filters for usernames, folder names. For example "user*"" will match names starting with "user". For provider events, this filter is applied to the username of the admin executing the event
rules.group_name_filters_help: Shell-like pattern filters for group names. For example "group*"" will match group names starting with "group"
rules.role_name_filters_help: Shell-like pattern filters for role names. For example "role*"" will match role names starting with "role"
rules.path_filters_help: Shell-like pattern filters on filesystem event paths. For example "/adir/*.txt"" will match paths in the "/adir" directory ending with ".txt". Double asterisk is supported, for example "/**/*.txt" will match any file ending with ".txt". "/mydir/**" will match any entry in "/mydir"
rules.file_size_limits_help: 0 means no limit. You can use MB/GB suffix
rules.actions_help: One or more actions to execute. The "Execute sync" option is supported for "upload" events and required for "pre-*" events and Identity provider login events if the action checks the account
rules.no_filter: No filter means always triggering events
